3 change points.

```{r}
change_point_data_3 <- sim_changepoint_sem(
  S0 = 1e3, I0 = 1e1, t_end = 10,
  theta = list(R0 = c(2.5, 1.5, 2.5, 1.0), gamma = 1, lambda = 1, shape = 1),
  change_day = c(2,6,8),
  iota_dist = "exponential",
  gener = FALSE, b = 1/2,
  E0 = 0, type = "SIR" # "SEIR"
)
```

# Below, we visualize the I(t) compartment over time.
```{r}
plot(x = change_point_data_3$t[1:2500], y = change_point_data_3$I[1:2500], main="Epidemic Trajectory",
   xlab="Time", ylab="I(t)")
```

# We will use only the partially observed (incidence) data as input to our DA-MCMC.
```{r}
cp_Y3 <- observed_data(change_point_data_3, K=20)
```

```{r}
# Change input to accommodate h_hat = 80
cp_Y3
```

```{r}
plot(x = cp_Y3$ts, y = c(0, cp_Y3$T_k), main="Observed Counts", xlab="Time", ylab="New Infections")
```

```{r}
theta0 = list(R0 = 1, beta=0.001, lambda = 1, shape = 1, gamma = 1)
```

```{r}
test_3 <- run_DAMCMC_complete_old(
  theta0, cp_Y3, N = 20000,
  rho = 0.2, param = "bg", approx = "ldp",
  iota_dist = "exponential", gener = FALSE, b = 1/2,
  thin = 1, plt = 2500,
  par_prior = list(
    a_beta = 1, b_beta = 1,
    a_gamma = 1, b_gamma = 1,
    a_R0 = 2, b_R0 = 2,
    a_lambda = 1, b_lambda = 1
  ), h_hat = rep(0.5,9), # P(dbeta_i = 1)
  x_b_ratio = 2,
  gamma=1
  ) 
```

```{r}
print(analyze_dbeta(test_3$dbeta_lst))
barplot(analyze_dbeta(test_3$dbeta_lst)[[2]], main="Delta Configurations", xlab="Change Point Location",  
 ylab="Count",
 border="blue")
abline(h=1/2, col="blue", lty="dashed", lwd=4)
```
4 change points.

```{r}
change_point_data_4 <- sim_changepoint_sem(
  S0 = 1e3, I0 = 1e1, t_end = 10,
  theta = list(R0 = c(2.25, 1.25, 2.0, 3.5, 1.5), gamma = 1, lambda = 1, shape = 1),
  change_day = c(3,4,6,8),
  iota_dist = "exponential",
  gener = FALSE, b = 1/2,
  E0 = 0, type = "SIR" # "SEIR"
)
# Below, we visualize the I(t) compartment over time.

plot(x = change_point_data_4$t[1:2500], y = change_point_data_4$I[1:2500], main="Epidemic Trajectory",
   xlab="Time", ylab="I(t)")
```

```{r}
cp_Y4 <- observed_data(change_point_data_4, K=25)
```

```{r}
plot(x = cp_Y4$ts, y = c(0, cp_Y4$T_k), main="Observed Counts", xlab="Time", ylab="New Infections")
```
```{r}
theta0 = list(R0 = 1, beta=0.001, lambda = 1, shape = 1, gamma = 1)
```

PPPM
```{r}
test_4 <- run_DAMCMC_complete_old(
  theta0, cp_Y4, N = 20000,
  rho = 0.2, param = "bg", approx = "ldp",
  iota_dist = "exponential", gener = FALSE, b = 1/2,
  thin = 1, plt = 2500,
  par_prior = list(
    a_beta = 1, b_beta = 1,
    a_gamma = 1, b_gamma = 1,
    a_R0 = 2, b_R0 = 2,
    a_lambda = 1, b_lambda = 1
  ), h_hat = rep(0.5,9), # P(dbeta_i = 1)
  x_b_ratio = 2,
  gamma=1
  ) 
```

```{r}
print(analyze_dbeta(test_4$dbeta_lst))
barplot(analyze_dbeta(test_4$dbeta_lst)[[2]], main="Delta Configurations", xlab="Change Point Location",  
 ylab="Count",
 border="blue")
abline(h=1/2, col="blue", lty="dashed", lwd=4)
```
HMM

```{r}
sim_MM_long_4 <- run_DAMCMC_complete_smallh6(
  theta0, cp_Y4, N = 20000,
  rho = 0.2, param = "bg", approx = "ldp",
  iota_dist = "exponential", gener = FALSE, b = 1/2,
  thin = 1, plt = 2500,
  par_prior = list(
    a_beta = 1, b_beta = 1,
    a_gamma = 1, b_gamma = 1,
    a_R0 = 2, b_R0 = 2,
    a_lambda = 1, b_lambda = 1,
    a_pi11 = 1, b_pi11 = 10,
    a_pi01 = 500, b_pi01 = 500
  ), 
  length_delta = 9,
  x_b_ratio = 2,
  gamma=1
  )
```


# Notice how setting a pi_11 ~ beta(1,10) causes the 4th cp to be missed. It may be unrealistic to run a simulation with two consecutive changes (on this time instant scale.)
```{r}
print(analyze_dbeta(sim_MM_long_4$dbeta_lst))
barplot(analyze_dbeta(sim_MM_long_4$dbeta_lst)[[2]], main="Delta Configurations", xlab="Change Point Location",  
 ylab="Count",names.arg = seq(1,9),
 border="blue")
abline(h=1/2, col="blue", lty="dashed", lwd=4)
```
